Biography: Abdulhamid is the CEO of Talabat, the leading online food delivery e-Commerce in the GCC. The firm evolved from a Kuwaiti based start-up to become a market leader in its space. He joined Talabat at an early stage and contributed to its growth from his post as head of Business development and Product. In 2015, Rocket Internet acquired Talabat for 170m USD, representing the largest Internet technology acquisition in the Middle East till date. Started his career in the IT and the Banking industries, and prior to joining Talabat he was the e-Channels team lead for Kuwait Finance House, one of the leading Islamic banks in the Middle East. Abdulhamid received his MBA from the University of Leeds with a BSc in Computer Science.

Dr Abdullah Al-Humaidi established KEH in 2008 and now holds the position of CEO. He has acted as CEO, Executive Vice Chairman and Chairman of several companies in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia and is also responsible for the investment strategy for two companies listed on the Kuwait Stock Exchange; Al Mudon and Remal. These responsibilities include investments in a variety of business sectors, primarily the medical, leisure and hotel sectors, as well as in a number of countries in addition to Kuwait, most notably the UK and Egypt.

Prior to his involvement with KEH, Dr Al-Humaidi studied medicine for seven years at the Royal College of Surgeons in Dublin, Ireland.

Abdulaziz holds a Bachelor's degree - double major in Information Systems and E-Commerce from University of Toledo, and an MBA degree from London Business School.
